summary: Today's Research Daily features new research reports on 16 major stocks, including Microsoft Corp. (MSFT), Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) and Mastercard Inc. as well as a micro-cap stock CBL & Associates Properties, Inc., (CBL) The microcap research content on these small and under-the-radar companies is the only research of its type in the country .  Microsoft’sshares outperformed the Zacks Computer - Software industry over the year-to-date period (+6.8% vs. +4.5%) Q3 fiscal 2025 earnings and revenues beat estimates .  Shares of Amazon.com have gained +14.5% over the past year against the Zacks Internet - Commerce industry’s gain of +18.7% . First-quarter results were driven by Prime and AWS momentum . Amazon announced mixed guidance for the second quarter .  Mastercard’sshares outperformed the Zacks Financial Transaction Services industry over the past year (+28.8% vs. +24.9%) High tariffs imposed by President Trump on goods imported from China have cast uncertainty on retailers such as Amazon.com .  CBL & Associates Properties outperformed the Zacks REIT and Equity Trust - Retail industry over the past year (+27% vs. +11.7%) This microcap company with market capitalization of $788.55 million have its balance sheet, driven by non-recourse debt and a $60 million year-over-year net debt reduction .  CBL’s valuation suggests relative value for investors seeking undervalued income-generating REITs . While rising expenses, soft tenant sales, sustainability risks and leasing headwinds pose risks .  Zacks analyst impressed with Medtronic's Cardiac Ablation Solutions business positively boosting growth in the Cardiovascular arm . Royal Caribbean likely to benefit from robust booking trends, strength in onboard consumer spending and digital innovations . Xcel Energy's investment of $45 billion through 2029 is likely to strengthen operations .  Tyson Foods is benefiting from its solid Chicken segment, fueled by operational improvements . Carlyle's global presence and efforts to expand business are likely to continue aiding asset under management (AUM) growth . Forex woes are an added concern for the company .  Copa Holdings (CPA) Benefits From Improving Air-Travel Demand . Amarin (AMRN) Rides on Robust Vascepa Sales Performance in EU . Ontario Innovation (ONTO) Hit By Tariff Headwinds & Rising Costs . USA Compression (USAC) Depends Heavily on Its Key Clients .  Volatile Capital Markets, High Costs Hurt Jefferies (JEF) Per the Zacks analyst, heightened volatility in the capital markets because of ongoing economic and policy concerns hurt Jefferies' top-line growth . Also, a steady rise in expenses is a headwind. affecting both incoming costs and export costs .

Nvidia shares rose nearly 6% to close just under $130 on Tuesday . The gains put Nvidia’s market capitalization at nearly $3.2 trillion, more than every other U.S. company aside from Microsoft and Apple . Nvidia will sell “several hundred thousand” advanced GPUs over the next five years .  Shares began a near-constant $3 trillion ascent in late 2022 when the release of ChatGPT sparked the generative AI boom . The company lost about $1.3 trillion in value between early January and early April as Wall Street questioned the economics of AI .
Tech stocks rose late Tuesday afternoon, with the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK) rising 2.2% . The Technology Select sector fund rose 2.6% Tuesday afternoon .

The planned layoffs will reduce the Washington-based tech company’s total workforce by 3%, CNBC reports . Roughly 228,000 people worked for Microsoft around the world as of the end of June 2024, though the company has axed some jobs since then .  Microsoft says it will make use of new technologies to help "empower employees to spend more time focusing on meaningful work" In the third quarter, Microsoft generated nearly $70.07 billion in revenue . The company’s market capitalization hovered around $3.34 trillion as of Tuesday afternoon .  Microsoft will lay off nearly 6,000 employees in push for efficiency . Microsoft plans to lay off 6,500 employees . Microsoft will also lay off employees in a bid to save the company's $3 billion annual budget .

Microsoft is cutting less than 3% of its global workforce, including at LinkedIn . The tech giant will make cuts across various locations, teams, and roles . The news comes less than two weeks after the Redmond, Washington-based company beat first-quarter earnings expectations .  Microsoft said it regularly adjusts its workforce to meet the strategic demands of the business . The layoffs would be the largest at the company since 2023, when Microsoft eliminated 10,000 jobs . CEO Satya Nadellapreviously saidMicrosoft planned to spend $80 million on AI infrastructure .  Microsoft isn't the only tech company to make cuts since the beginning of this year . Facebook parent company Meta Platformscut about 5% of its workforce in February . Amazon announced it waslaying off dozens of employees at the end of January .

WizardLM, a Beijing-based Microsoft AI research group, appears to have joined Tencent . Can Xu, a senior AI researcher, said he and the team left Microsoft to join Hunyuan, one of Tencent's AI development orgs . It's not clear how many researchers are still a part of WizardLM or when it might've left Microsoft .  Microsoft pulled a family of AI models from the web after only a day . The WizardLM-2 was supposed to be competitive with OpenAI'sGPT-4 . Microsoft said the models hadn't undergone "toxicity testing"  Tencent recently restructuredits Hunyuan team, establishing two new units and upping its AI infrastructure spending . Tencent has said that it plans to put 90 billion yuan, or around $12.49 billion, toward capital expenditures this year .

The tech giant did not disclose the total number of lost jobs but it will amount to about 6,000 people . Microsoft employed 228,000 full-time workers as of last June, the last time it reported its annual headcount . Notices to employees began going out on Tuesday .  Microsoft’s chief financial officer Amy Hood said on an April earnings call that the company was focused on “building high-performing teams and increasing our agility by reducing layers with fewer managers” Microsoft has said it has been spending 80 billion dollars (£60 billion) in the fiscal year ending in June .  Microsoft chief executive Satya Nadella told Meta boss Mark Zuckerberg at an AI event last month that “maybe 20, 30% of the code” for some of Microsoft’s coding projects “are probably all written by software” work .

The global cloud computing market was valued at $752.44 billion in 2024 and is expected to witness a CAGR of 20.4% from 2025 to 2030 . Both DELL and MSFT are likely to gain from the massive growth opportunity highlighted by the growth pace .  ISG Group revenues, which include its cloud offerings, increased 22% year over year to $11.35 billion . The upside can be attributed to servers and networking revenues of $6.63 billion, which grew 37% year on year .  Microsoft Cloud revenues reached $42.4 billion, growing 21% year over year and 22% in constant currency . Microsoft remains the cloud of choice for customers’ mission-critical workloads . Abercrombie & Fitch, Coca-Cola, and ServiceNow expanding their use of Azure .  Year to Date, Dell Technologies shares have lost 11.4%, while Microsoft shares have gained 6.5% . The decline in Dell Technologies' shares is attributed to higher U.S. tariffs, particularly those imposed on China, and the associated risk of a recession . The outperformance of Microsoft can be attributed to the strength of its AI business .  The Zacks Consensus Estimate for DELL’s fiscal 2026 earnings is pegged at $8.90 per share, which has declined 0.7% over the past 30 days . Microsoft stands out as the stronger investment opportunity . Microsoft offers greater upside potential due to its strong AI-driven cloud .  Microsoft has a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy), making the stock a stronger pick than Dell Technologies . Dell Technologies is making strides in AI infrastructure, but its performance and growth prospects lag behind Microsoft in the cloud computing space .

Microsoft is cutting around 6,000 roles, or 3% of its global workforce, to “reduce management layers” This comes after Microsoft posted abetter-than-expected $25.8 billion in the most recent quarter . It’s the latest in a series of rationalizations at the company, with Microsoft also cutting several roles in January .  Microsoft has been investing billions in AI technology, including ChatGPT . LinkedIn is scaling back its Chinese operations, meaning less oversight will be required . The move could also mean an increase in AI usage internally, and an expansion of its AI tools .  LinkedIn is moving forward with new tools to help keep people on LinkedIn operations moving forward . LinkedIn's new tools include a tool to help you keep up with your career prospects .

ChatGPT, OpenAI’s text-generating AI chatbot, has taken the world by storm since its launch in November 2022 . The company has been hit with lawsuits from Alden Global Capital-owned newspapersalleging copyright infringement .  The ChatGPT deep research feature is in beta and lets developers connect with GitHub to ask questions about codebases and engineering documents . The connector will soon be available for ChatGpt Plus, Pro, and Team users, with Enterprise and Education coming shortly .  OpenAI is unveiling a program called OpenAI for Countries . Program will help organizations in Asia meet their local data sovereignty requirements when using OpenAI's products . The AI startup will work with governments to increase data center capacity .  OpenAI's ChatGPT has been rolling back an update to its default AI model . The company is working on "additional fixes" to the model's personality . Over the weekend, users on social media criticized the new model for making it too validating .  OpenAI has added a few features to its ChatGPT search tool to give users an improved online shopping experience . The chatbot provides recommendations, images, and reviews of products in various categories such as fashion, beauty, home goods, and electronics .  OpenAI released a new AI model called GPT-4.1 in mid-April . Multiple independent tests indicate that the model is less reliable than previous OpenAI releases . Questions have been raised regarding OpenAI's transparency and procedures for testing models .  OpenAI has released two new reasoning models, o3 and o4 mini, for biological and chemical threats . The company claims o3 is the most advanced reasoning model it has developed, while o4-mini is said to provide a balance of price, speed and performance .  OpenAI will discontinue its largest AI model, GPT-4.5, from its API even though it was just launched in late February . The move shows how commercial AI developers face more pressure to rapidly implement models due to increased competition . OpenAI is currently developing its own social media platform to compete with Elon Musk's X and Mark Zuckerberg's Instagram .  GPT-4.1 will rival AI models such as Google's Gemini 2.5 Pro and Anthropic's Claude 3.7 Sonnet . OpenAI may launch several new AI models soon, The Verge reports .  OpenAI is working on a watermarking feature for images generated using GPT-4o . The feature is rolling out to ChatGPT Pro and Plus users first, excluding those in the U.K., EU, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland .  More than 130 million users have created over 700 million images since ChatGPT got the upgraded image generator on March 25 . The image generator went viral for being able to create Ghibli-style photos . Arc Prize Foundation updated the estimated computing costs for OpenAI's o3 "reasoning" model .  OpeanAI plans to release its "first" open language modelsinceGPT-2"in the coming months . The company plans to host developer events to gather feedback and showcase prototypes of the model .  OpenAI has added Context Protocol (MCP) to its ChatGPT desktop app . MCP is an open-source standard that lets developers create bidirectional links between data sources and AI applications like chatbots . The latest update of the image generator on OpenAI’s ChatGPThas triggered a flood of AI-generated memes .  ChatGPT can now usethe GPT-4omodel to generate and edit images and photos directly . The feature went live earlier this week for subscribers of the company’s Pro plan, priced at $200 a month .  OpenAI has updated its AI voice assistant with improved chat capabilities . The update enables real-time conversations, and the AI assistant is said to be more personable and interrupts users less often . Users on ChatGPT's free tier can now access the new version of Advanced Voice Mode .  Reliance Jio has proposed selling OpenAI’s models to businesses in India through an application programming interface . Meta plans to bolster its presence in India by constructing a large 3GW data center in Jamnagar, Gujarat .  OpenAI has added new transcription and voice-generating AI models to its API . The company claims they are improved versions of what was already there and that they hallucinate less . OpenAI charges $150 for every million tokens (about 750,000 words) input into the model .  OpenAI has not extensively explored the use of AI for writing fiction . It costs twice as much as its GPT-4.5 for input and 10 times the price of regular o1. produces .  The Responses API enables enterprises to develop customized AI agents that can perform web searches, scan through company files, and navigate websites . The most expensive rumored agents are said to be aimed at supporting “PhD-level research,” are expected to cost $20,000 per month .  The latest version of the MacOS ChatGPT app allows users to edit code directly in supported developer tools, including Xcode, VS Code, and JetBrains . It's unclear when these agentic tools might launch or which customers will be eligible to buy them . The company plans to roll it out to Enterprise, Edu, and free users .  ChatGPT usage spiked from April to May 2024, shortly after that model’s launch . CEO Sam Altman said in the coming months, OpenAI will release a model called GPT-5 that “integrates a lot of [OpenAI's] technology,” including o3 . As a result of that decision, the company won't release o3 as a standalone model .  ChatGPT users will see an updated “chain of thought” that shows more of the model’s “reasoning” steps and how it arrived at answers to questions . OpenAI announced a new AI “agent” called deep research designed to help people conduct in-depth, complex research .  OpenAI launched a new AI “reasoning” model, o3-mini, the latest in the company’s o family of models . OpenAI says it collects userposts from the subreddit r/ChangeMyView to measure its AI reasoning abilities .  OpenAI launched ChatGPT Gov designed to provide U.S. government agencies an additional way to access the tech . Pew Research Center polled 1,400 teens ages 13 to 17 about how they've used chatGPT for homework .  OpenAI is launching a research preview of Operator, a general-purpose AI agent . Operator promises to automate tasks such as booking travel accommodations, making restaurant reservations, and shopping online . Changes to ChatGPT’s code base suggest Operator will be available as an early research preview .  OpenAI has begun testing a feature that lets new ChatGPT users sign up with only a phone number . The feature is currently in beta in the U.S. and India . Users who create an account using their number can’t upgrade to one of OpenAI’s paid plans without an email .  ChatGPT is a general-purpose chatbot that uses artificial intelligence to generate text after a user enters a prompt . The chatbot uses GPT-4, a large language model that uses deep learning to produce human-like text . November 30, 2022 is when the chatbot was released for public use .  ChatGPT is AI-powered and utilizes LLM technology to generate text after a prompt . A chatbot can be any software/system that holds dialogue with you/a person but doesn't necessarily have to be AI .  Users have noted that there are some character limitations after around 500 words . While ChatGPT can write workable Python code, it can’t necessarily program an entire program .  ChatGPT has no built-in sharing features yet . Users can make requests for deletion of AI-generated references about you . OpenAI has said individuals in “certain jurisdictions” can object to the processing of their personal information .  ChatGPT maker makes a passing acknowledgement of the objection requirements attached to relying on "legitimate interest" An Australian mayor has publicly announced he may sue OpenAI for defamation due to false claims he had served time in prison for bribery .  New York City Public Schools have banned ChatGPT from their networks and devices . The private equity company that owns CNET, Red Ventures, wasaccusedof using ChatGpt for SEO farming, even if the information was incorrect .  ChatGPT has a tendency to regurgitate content from its training data, which would have implications for AI systems trained on publicly available data . Text-generating AI models like chatGPT have a tendency of regurgitating content from their training data .

C3.ai, Inc.AI andUiPath Inc. PATH are both high-profile players in the booming AI automation sector . Both companies have seen recent momentum amid the broader artificial intelligence hype .  C3.ai markets itself as an enterprise AI pure play, offering a suite of prebuilt, configurable AI applications that help large organizations implement predictive analytics, detect anomalies, and optimize operations . In theory, this makes its platform highly scalable across sectors .  C3.ai is the most sought-after AI application onMicrosoft’s MSFT Azure cloud marketplace . The company has secured large customers and pilots — recent announced deals include ExxonMobilXOM, the U.S. Navy, Shell, BASF and multiple state/local governments .  C3.ai reported total revenues of $98.8 million in its fiscal third-quarter results . Subscription revenues grew 22% year over year to $85.7 million, constituting 87% of total revenues . The company faces significant challenges, including the need to achieve sustainable profitability .  UiPath operates in the adjacent, yet distinct, space of robotic process automation . Its platform automates rule-based, repetitive digital tasks—freeing up human workers and reducing costs for businesses . Growth also appears to be moderating after a surge in activity .  90% of surveyed enterprises see opportunities for agentic AI in their workflows . UiPath enjoys very high gross margins (85% non-GAAP in the fiscal fourth quarter) and has been streamlining its cost structure, supporting improved profitability .  The company ended the year with about $1.7 billion in cash on its balance sheet and launched a $500 million share buyback program . Free cash flow was robust, reaching $328 million in fiscal 2025 . On the other hand, UiPath faces challenges .  PATH (up 3%) has performed better than AI (down 29.7%) so far in 2025 . Over the past month, PATH has gained 22.2%, more than AI’s 20.6% rally . C3.ai carries a higher valuation premium and lacks current profitability .  The Zacks Consensus Estimate for C3.ai’s 2025 bottom line suggests a 4.3% improvement, while that for PATH indicates a year-over-year decline of 1.9% . UiPath is larger and almost cash-flow positive, generating profits on a non-GAAP basis, boasts a strong balance sheet .  UiPath, while growing more slowly, has a more proven business model and valuation that is easier to justify . C3.ai — a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) company — could outperform on strong AI tailwinds, but it is riskier and richly priced .  UiPath, Inc. (PATH) and Alphabet (GOOGL) are both listed in the U.S. market . Alphabet Inc. is listed as a Google-Alphabet company .

Microsoft is laying off about 3% of its global workforce . The move is the company's largest headcount cut in more than two years . Microsoft framed the move as part of “organizational changes necessary to best position the company for success”  Revenue hit $70.1 billion, up 13%, with Azure and other cloud revenue growing 33% year-over-year . Nearly half of that cloud growth came from AI workloads . Microsoft stock is up around 6% year to date, and up 200% since the pandemic-era stock lows of 2020 .  Mass cuts gave way to more surgical trims, with companies saying sayonara to low-priority initiatives or those misaligned with fresh strategic visions . Tech firms have quietly kept reshaping their org charts, thinning layers, and reallocating headcount toward AI-driven bets . Tuesday’s move by Microsoft slots cleanly into the narrative .

Microsoft is looking to cut about 3% of its global workforce, CNBC reports . The tech giant's CFO said in last month's earnings call that the company is focused on "increasing our agility by reducing layers with fewer managers" Microsoft said in mid-2024 that it had about 228,000 full-time employees .  Microsoft's headcount at the end of March was up 2% year-over-year, but down slightly from previous quarter . CrowdStrike Holdings last week said it would cut about 500 jobs, or 5% of its total headcount . Microsoft's shares were up slightly in recent trading Tuesday afternoon .

Nvidia (NVDA) stock surged 5.6% on Tuesday, pushing the company's market capitalization to close above $3 trillion for the first time since February . Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said Tuesday during an investment forum in Saudi Arabia that the AI chipmakerwill ship its chips to Saudi Arabian AI company Humainfor its massive data center plans .  Nvidia, Apple, Microsoft, and Microsoft have taken turns as the world's most valuable company over the past year . The AI chipmaker has also underperformed the S&P 500 for the first time in years . Trump's trade policies have both helped and hurt Nvidia .  $16 billion in the current fiscal year from the H20 ban . The ban comes just as competition ramps up from Chinese tech firm Huawei, which is reportedly poised to begin shipping chips competitive with Nvidia's older Hopper chips .  Nvidia's gain puts its market capitalization at $3.17 trillion, but shares are still down more than 3% in 2025 . Microsoft reaffirmed its $80 billion spending plan to build out AI data centers . Meta raised its capital expenditure outlook for 2025 as high as $72 billion .

Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) is revising terms of its deal with ChatGPT parent OpenAI . The emerging deal would enable OpenAI to go public while protecting MSFT's access to the start-up's technology . Microsoft has reportedly agreed to forego a portion of its equity stake in return for the right to utilize new technologies developed by OpenAI after 2030 .  In the last month, MSFT has gained 16%, while the shares have advanced 9% in the last three months . While we acknowledge the potential of MSFT, our conviction lies in the belief that AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns .

Microsoft is laying off 3% of its workforce, or roughly 7,000 employees, CNBC reports . The cuts will be across all levels and geographies, and are likely the largest since Microsoft laid off 10,000 in 2023 . The company's stock was slightly lower in morning trading .  Microsoft’s reported move comes weeks after the company posted stronger-than-expected growth in its cloud-computing business Azure . The company had a total of 228,000 workers, with 126,000 employees in the United States at the end of June last year .

Perplexity is in advanced talks to raise $500M in a round that values it at $14B . The venture firm Accel is set to lead the round, people familiar with the matter said . It is one of a set of startups that have grown quickly after the launch of Microsoft-backed OpenAI’s ChatGPT three years ago . Microsoft began laying off about 6,000 workers Tuesday, nearly 3% of its workforce . Hard hit was the tech giant's home state of Washington, where it was cutting 1,985 workers tied to its Redmond headquarters . Microsoft said the layoffs will be across all levels, teams and geographies .  Microsoft announced a smaller round of performance-based layoffs in January . The 3% cuts will be Microsoft's biggest since early 2023 . Microsoft employed 228,000 full-time workers as of last June, the last time it reported its annual headcount .  The company didn't give a specific reason for the layoffs, only that they were part of "organizational changes necessary to best position the company for success in a dynamic marketplace" Microsoft has said it has been spending $80 billion in the fiscal year that ends in June .  AI tools have been pitched as changing the way people work, including in Microsoft's own workplaces . Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella told Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg last month that “maybe 20, 30% of the code” for some of Microsoft's coding projects “are probably all written by software”  Of the laid-off employees in Washington, about 1,500 worked in person at Microsoft's offices and 475 worked remotely . Tech companies are still in a process of “coming back to Earth and trying to rebalance some things, an economist says .  Tariffs hit U.S. produce that are more expensive due to tariffs . "You maybe don’t have as much discretionary income to spend on electronics or video game systems," she says .

Microsoft Corporation will lay off approximately 3% of its global workforce . The cuts will affect employees across all levels, teams, and regions . Microsoft has been reshaping its workforce to align with evolving business priorities, including investments in cloud infrastructure and artificial intelligence .  Microsoft stock has fallen 0.4% following the announcement, attributable to a general market rebalance after yesterday’s trading surge . Tech-sector job reductions in recent months as large companies look to boost efficiency following years of expansion .

Kyndryl expanded its partnership with Microsoft to extend its hybrid cloud integration services . The IT services provider will leverage the hyperscaler’sadaptive cloud methodologyand Azure Arc and Azure Local platforms . Initial use cases are designed for retail, manufacturing, energy and healthcare organizations .  Kyndryl built its IT services and consulting business around helping enterprises navigate to the cloud through thickets of legacy applications and on-premises infrastructure . The company ended its 2025 fiscal year in the black with net income of $68 million for the three months ending March 31 .  Kyndryl’s hyperscaler-related revenues more than doubled to $1.2 billion in FY2025 . The company expects revenues tied to its cloud alliances to grow another 50% in the next fiscal year .

The cuts will be across all levels and geographies and are likely the largest since Microsoft laid off 10,000 employees in 2023 . Big Tech has been spending heavily on AI as they see the new technology as a major growth engine, while slashing costs elsewhere to safeguard profit margins .  Microsoft has earmarked $80 billion in capital spending this fiscal year . Most of it is aimed at expanding data centers to ease capacity bottlenecks for artificial intelligence services . Microsoft Cloud margins narrowed to 69% in the March quarter from 72% a year ago . Analyst Gil Luria says Microsoft is "very closely" managing the margin pressure .  At least 10,000 jobs would be needed "to make up for the higher depreciation levels due to their capital expenditures," the analyst said .

Google Bard and Search Generative Experience are powered by Gemini Pro to deliver an enhanced user experience . Google Cloud unveiled its Cloud Wide Area Network, giving enterprises access to its private global fiber network . Bill Gates announced plans to close the Gates Foundation in 2045 . Microsoft founder says he intends to give away 99% of his $168 billion fortune through the organization over the next 20 years .  Bill Gates andMelinda French Gates established the Gates foundation in 2000 . Originally, Gates said that the plan was for the organization to continue its work for decades after the pair's deaths . To date, the foundation has given away $102.3 billion .  Gates said that he expects the foundation to spend $200 billion between now and 2045 . The tech luminary also said he hopes this decision will inspire other billionaires to give more while they're living . In 2010, Gates, French Gates, andWarren Buffett launched theGiving Pledge .  Bill Gates plans to give away 99% of his wealth over the next two decades . Melinda French Gates exited the Gates Foundation last year, following the couple's divorce in 2021 .  4,000 of its pre-IPO shares for just $0.30/share! Get the latest stock analysis from Benzinga? The Zacks Expected Surprise Prediction, or ESP, works by locking in on the most up-to-date analyst earnings revisions . The ESP is more accurate than estimates from weeks or even months before the actual release date . Rising above expectations is often rewarded, while falling short can come with negative consequences .  Intuit (INTU) is one of just a large database of Computer and Technology stocks with positive ESPs . INTU has an Earnings ESP figure of 0.43%, which is calculated by taking the percentage difference between the $10.94 Most Accurate Estimate and the overall Zacks Consensus Estimate . Microsoft (MSFT) holds a #2 (Buy) ranking on the Zacks Rank, and it's Most accurate Estimate is $3.35 a share 77 days from its next quarterly update .  INTU and MSFT's positive ESP figures tell us that both stocks have a good chance at beating analyst expectations in their next earnings report . Use the Zacks Earnings ESP Filter to turn up stocks with the highest probability of positively, or negatively, surprising to buy or sell .

OpenAI and Microsoft engaged in negotiations to redefine their multibillion-dollar partnership . The discussions aim to facilitate OpenAI's potential IPO while ensuring Microsoft retains access to cutting-edge AI models . The companies are also revising a contract from 2019, which currently extends to 2030 .  OpenAI abandoned plans to remove its non-profit board's control but retained intentions for its business arm to become a public benefit corporation . Microsoft integrates OpenAI's technology into its software while providing significant computing power for AI model training .  OpenAI raised $6.6bn in October 2024 and an additional $40bn in March2025 . Recent investors, including Microsoft and SoftBank, do not view their backing as a donation . Investors can recoup their investments if OpenAI fails to restructure .  Failure to establish a public benefit corporation could hinder OpenAI's fundraising, IPO prospects, and ability to compete with Big Tech rivals . OpenAI must convince authorities in California and Delaware that its proposal aligns with its mission to benefit the public .

Microsoft(MSFT) is a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) that has a D for Value and a B for Growth . Microsoft 365 Copilot has been singled out in recent earnings conference calls as an emerging winner and that could reshape the AI space .  The company was founded by Paul Gardner Allen and William Henry Gates, III in 1975 . MSFT has invested over $13B in OpenAi which recently scrapped its plans to switch from a not for profit to a for profit company .  Microsoft(MSFT) has posted four consecutive beats of the Zacks Consensus Estimate . The company has an average positive earnings surprise of 5.2% over the last year . The most recent earnings print saw the company post $3.46 when the consensus was at $2.20 .  The forward PE of 33x is a little rich, but one has to include the $13B investment the company has in OpenAI . I see revenue in 2025 will come in around $278B which will end up being growth of about 13.6% . The most recent quarter saw topline growth of 13.3% .  Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) post solid revenue growth . Microsoft Corporation is one of the top-ranked companies in the U.S. market . The company is expected to report a solid quarterly report in the coming weeks .

Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF MAGS has lost 6.4% so far this year (as of May 12, 2025) The group of tech giants known as the "Magnificent Seven" has been battered by the tariff turmoil . The latest U.S.-China temporary trade truce came as a surprising relief to the space .  The United States agreed to temporarily lower tariffs on Chinese imports . The reductions will last 90 days, following two days of high-stakes talks between the two nations . Along with Apple, Tesla is heavily dependent on Chinese parts and battery suppliers .  Chinese clients make up between 20% and 40% of NVIDIA’s end customer base, according to DA Davidson analyst Gil Luria . 90% of iPhones are manufactured in China, representing 17% of 2024 revenues . Meta: Chinese advertisers contributed roughly 11% of total ad spending, Raymon James noted .  Meta-heavy ETFs like Fidelity MSCI Communication Services Index ETFFCOM can be played for specific stock preference . Consumer Discretionary Select Sector SPDR FundXLY invests about 35% of its basket in Amazon and Tesla .  SPDR S&P 500 ETF (SPY) (XLY) (XLG) iShares Global Tech ETF (IXN) (IGN) iSXLY (IGT) (AGT) and (IGTC) (GOOGL) are all listed in the XLY index .

The Big Tech trade was alive — and well, even before the announcement of a temporary deal with China . Negotiations between the US and China yieldeda 90-day pause, removing sharpest fangs from tariffs the rival nations set on each other . The stock market celebrated the lower chances of a global recession and Chinese-American splintering .  Wedbush analyst Dan Ives says new highs for tech stocks are now on the table in 2025 . The risks of a prolonged conflict with Chinato Magnificent Seven members have been weighing on investors .  As a group, the Mag Seven stocks are still way off their highs from earlier this year . Still, investors have benefited relative to the broader market by holding these names . Most of the names have posted significant gains since the 90-day global tariff pause . The opt-out claim has been brought by barrister Alexander Wolfson . It says it could apply to millions of UK consumers, businesses and public bodies . The claim alleges Microsoft has abused its market dominance and imposed restrictive licensing practices . As a result, consumers and businesses who purchased licences for some Microsoft software products between October 1 2015 and the present day were overcharged .  Microsoft has been contacted for comment . In December, a separate £1 billion claim was made by Alexander Wolfson . The case has the potential to restore greater fairness and accountability to the UK’s digital economy .  Microsoft customers using rival cloud computing platforms to Microsoft’s own Azure were charged higher licensing fees to access its Windows server . Microsoft. filed with the UK's Competition Appeal Tribunal .

Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has been a disappointing stock over the past year . Since May 2024, AMD has been down almost 32% . AMD has also struggled with a lack of competitiveness in absorbing that demand .  The first five months of 2025 have been marked by growing uncertainty around demand for infrastructure chips . Super Micro Computer recently posted results with a weaker-than-expected outlook for the upcoming quarter, citing delays in AI server orders .  Big Tech companies are increasingly buying chips directly from manufacturers like Nvidia and AMD, and building AI systems in-house, bypassing integrators like SMCI . The market remains skeptical about infrastructure chipmakers, especially AMD .  Most of the current AI buildout is GPU-driven, rather than focused on traditional CPUs . AMD is effectively left with pent-up demand, which it hasn't been able to unlock . As a result, AMD continues to lag behind NVIDIA in absorbing the surging demand for AI infrastructure .  AMD is currently priced near the lowest levels seen in the last three years, having hit a low of 19x just a few weeks ago . That’sa significant drop from its peak multiple of 63x in Q1 of last year . The lower multiple suggests AMD could be de-risked enough to justify a bullish thesis, but it also reflects investors’ hesitation to pay a premium for its long-term story .  AMD is trading at a PEG ratio of 0.8x, making it look even cheaper relative to growth . For short-term traders looking to navigate AMD’s high volatility, which amounts to around 45% annually, a more tactical approach is key . I suggest a strategy based on moving average crossovers—specifically watching fora bullish signal when the 50-day MA crosses above the 200-day .  AMD recently posted a decent quarter, but it comes amid some paradoxes in the AI infrastructure chip market . AMD’s valuation may appear more de-risked than in years, but I would still wait for more explicit confirmation of a bullish trend before initiating a long position .
Microsoft (MSFT) and OpenAI (OpenAI) are rewrites by Microsoft . Microsoft's comment in the fifth paragraph was made in response to a request for comment .
